name: nytimes
text:

name: nytimes
text:
President Trump paid only $750 in federal income tax in 2016 and in 2017.

Here’s how his accountants arrived at that figure for 2017, Trump’s first year in office.
https://t.co/QgspS86o5Y

name: nytimes
text: Drawing from Trump’s tax-return data for 2017, here is the math used to determine his total income. https://t.co/QgspS86o5Y https://t.co/2TKRhnxSgt

name: nytimes
text:
Trump was subject to the Alternative Minimum Tax, a tripwire to prevent wealthy individuals from entirely erasing their tax liability. But he reduced the AMT by using the General Business Credit, an array of incentives and givebacks to business owners.
 https://t.co/QgspS86o5Y https://t.co/dheCGVzNpR

name: nytimes
text:
Trump had more than enough business credit to cancel out his $7,435,857 tax bill. But for some reason, his accountants subtracted $750 from his allowable credit. The result was a total federal income tax liability of $750.
https://t.co/QgspS86o5Y
